questions.question: The person ___ car was stolen reported it to the police.
The building, ___ windows are all broken, will be renovated.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' can be used with things to show possession.

questions.question: The manager ___ team won the award was very proud.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' is used for possession even with people in relative clauses.

questions.question: I spoke to the author ___ book became a bestseller.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' is used to indicate that the book belongs to the author.

questions.question: They moved to a town ___ name I can’t pronounce.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' indicates possession of the name by the town.

questions.question: She hired the candidate ___ résumé impressed everyone.
questions.explanation: 'Whose résumé' indicates possession, so 'whose' is correct.

questions.question: The scientist ___ theory changed everything won the prize.
They visited the museum ___ location is famous worldwide.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' refers to the location of the museum, showing possession.

questions.question: This is the actor ___ movies always break records.
questions.explanation: 'Whose' is used to show the actor owns the movies.

questions.question: The organization ___ mission is to help animals needs support.
questions.explanation: 'Whose mission' shows possession of the mission.

questions.question: The committee ___ decision was final met last night.
questions.explanation: 'Whose decision' shows possession by the committee.

questions.question: The company ___ employees went on strike is negotiating.
That’s the man ___ daughter is in my class.
I live in a house ___ roof leaks during rain.
questions.explanation: 'Whose roof' indicates the house owns the roof.

questions.question: She met a student ___ results were impressive.
questions.explanation: 'Whose results' implies possession by the student.
